well I suspect that it's due to indexing, but not sure. I don't need index_select in the function that I think has slowed down, I'm just looping through a 1-D tensor, something like this

indices = sparse_tensor._indices()
columns = indices[1] # the size can be in thousands

for col in range(columns.size(0)):
  # reading columns[col]

body:
well I suspect that it's due to indexing, but not sure. I don't need `index_select` in the function that I think has slowed down, I'm just looping through a 1-D tensor, something like this
```python
indices = sparse_tensor._indices()
columns = indices[1] # the size can be in thousands

for col in range(columns.size(0)):
  # reading columns[col]
```
